Articles.Content:
All, I am considering gifting the repo for RealISRU to the <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> Group on Github. In its current state this would mean a new fork or perhaps redirecting your personal repo to the new master (not sure, not a git guru). In truth I should have done this a long time ago and I apologize for that considering just how out of the loop I am on this and modding in general, and even KSP in a sense.

What say you?

E: I can even set a time for it in order to allow everyone to push their current changes so that forks can be made fresh if need be. Let me know your thoughts.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-03-06T21:14:23Z" title="03/06/2017 09:14  PM" data-short="7 yr">March 6, 2017</time> by regex**

All, I am setting the official repo move/gifting to Friday March 24th between 11:00am ~ 2:00pm PST. Make sure you've pushed/pulled/committed/ your work the night before I move the repo. This will give @stratochief66 and other RO maintainers more flexibility to work on the project. At the very least it puts it into the right hands.

[@stratochief66](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/59541-stratochief66/) I just want to mention I had missed your comments on my fixes on the licquefaction array & drills' cfgs on github. I replied a couple of weeks ago stating this and now just wanted to let you know in case is relevant in light of the repo move [@regex](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/70807-regex/) will be performing.

Best regards to all!

RealISRU now lives in the KSP-<abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> group. Please point your repos/pull requests to [https://github.com/KSP-<abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>/RealISRU](https://github.com/KSP-RO/RealISRU)

**Edited <time datetime="2017-03-27T19:00:39Z" title="03/27/2017 07:00  PM" data-short="7 yr">March 27, 2017</time> by regex**

I have my doubts that I will even get a reply, but I see some work was done on this mod this year at least and I was wondering what state it was in as I am very much missing <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr> from realism overhaul... It would be the only thing I think that is really missing, even cyro fuels have been fixed.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-10-01T08:07:37Z" title="10/01/2018 08:07  AM" data-short="5 yr">October 1, 2018</time> by etheoma**

[@etheoma](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/69258-etheoma/) - I too would love a full <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr> suite for Realism Overhaul. I believe this has now been bundled with <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>. Current available parts (if my memory does not fail) are as follows: Resource Drill that extracts water, hydrates and not much else I believe; Licquefaction Array, which liquefies gases such as Oxygen, Hydrogen, CO2, Methane, and maybe some others (its config file is very easy to understand, so you could tweak it to get your desired substance in there); Mars Atmospheric Scoop that captures CO2 from the atmosphere; and then there is a Water Electrolyser, a SABATIER unit, a Fischer-Tropsch unit, and I think that's pretty much it (again, I might be missing something).

In conclusion, with the mod in its current state you are able to mine hydrates at the Moon or Mars and get drinking water; you can produce Lqd Methane in Mars for fuel, and I believe (never tested) you could produce Kerosene at Titan as well. Again, these are only the limited uses I gave the hardware, but I'm almost certain there are more resources to be produced.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-10-01T18:54:33Z" title="10/01/2018 06:54  PM" data-short="5 yr">October 1, 2018</time> by hypervelocity**

[@etheoma](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/69258-etheoma/) [@hypervelocity](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/136426-hypervelocity/)

As to the state of the mod, I've been going over recipes and making sure that they are consistent and accurate as best I can. I've also replaced unrealistic power production parts (which I think were just for testing anyway) with more reasonable parts (10kW and 40kW Kilopower reactors). I wouldn't say it's complete but it's more so than when I started looking into it. Right now I think I'm \*IT\* as far as contributors go although I've had input from a couple of members in #<abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>.

So if you think there's anything missing or if something needs correcting, raise an issue at [https://github.com/KSP-<abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>/RealISRU](https://github.com/KSP-RO/RealISRU) which I have write access to and I'll try to address it.

I probably won't be able to do anything with regards to models which is too bad because the Kilopower reactors could use decent models, especially the animated umbrella radiators.

[@etheoma](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/69258-etheoma/) - take it easy pal, there's people trying to help out here - go look at the mod's folder, find the licquefaction array CFG, check the part name and/or manufacturer, look it up in the game - if its not there, your installation is corrupted.

ALSO: I play at KSP 1.2.2 and I \*do\* have a RealISRU folder under the manufacturers filter in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>/<abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr>.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-10-02T15:03:28Z" title="10/02/2018 03:03  PM" data-short="5 yr">October 2, 2018</time> by hypervelocity**

> 
> 
> 3 minutes ago, hypervelocity said:
> 
> 
> thanks for your efforts [@Starwaster](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/71262-starwaster/)!!!!
> 
> 
> 
> 
> you are actually blowing my mind with the idea of recapturing boiled off gasses - would you mind explaining in detail how would I go about doing so?
> 

Just use a ServiceModule type tank and it will produce the appropriate gas for O2, LH2, NH3 and CH4 automagically. There needs to be another tank to receive the gas. Then just use the liquefier to turn it back to liquid. Best used in conjunction with MLI (multi-layered insulation) and radiators. Except you would need to upgrade to RF for KSP 1.3.1 as we don't have an official release for 1.2.2 which supported player added MLI insulation.

You can patch the tank system to add boiloff gas production to any tank with the following patch. (it's a little brute forcish with no conditionals but it does the job)

One caveat in doing this is that any boiloff gas that is captured is NOT used for propulsive venting which is used for settling tanks. (that's why I only added it to the ServiceModule tank type)

    @TANK_DEFINITION[*]:NEEDS[RealFuels]:FINAL
    {@TANK[LqdOxygen]{	%boiloffProduct = Oxygen}@TANK[LqdHydrogen]{	%boiloffProduct = Hydrogen}@TANK[LqdMethane]{	%boiloffProduct = Methane}@TANK[LqdAmmonia]{	%boiloffProduct = Ammonia}
    }

[@hypervelocity](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/136426-hypervelocity/) So where would I find that, I did a search on a new install of KSP and Realism overhall with a new <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr> and a searched the term licquefaction and array and it's not showing up, you said it is a separate file right, it's not in a config file, but file in and of it's self, well if so either <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">Ckan</abbr> is bugged, it's been removed from <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> or I am the most unlucky person on earth to get two corrupted installs with the exact same problem.

Have either of you installed a new KSP 1.3.1 in the last 3 months and seen if it is actually still there?

[@etheoma](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/69258-etheoma/) - that is strange - if you can wait until tomorrow I will get back to my pc and provide a detailed walkthrough on how to find the part & associated cfg file, and screenshots of how my install looks like so you can replicate in your build.

[@etheoma](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/69258-etheoma/) Real <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr> is a separate download and install. You don't get it just by installing Realism Overhaul. And it has not been released to <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> unless someone put their own branch of it up there.

If you did not download from [https://github.com/KSP-<abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>/RealISRU](https://github.com/KSP-RO/RealISRU)  (click the green 'Clone or Download' button) then you don't even HAVE Real <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr>.

if you depend on others for your own success you are not doing things quite right. I said "I believe" it was bundled with <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>. good luck to you now.
